incidents.name: Lookup v1 Traffic Interrupted Due to Rest Proxy Migration

incident_updates.body: Twilio Lookup v1 was degraded for 1 minute between 7:13AM and 7:14AM Pacific Time on 06/11/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced 500 errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Lookup SIM Swap Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Lookup SIM Swap was degraded for 138 minutes between 2:50:00 and 5:08 Pacific Time on 06/12/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced problem symptoms such as interrupted calls and messages. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Super SIM Connectivity Issues Causing Attachment Failures

incident_updates.body: Around 14:57 UTC, we again lost signaling traffic from our impacted downstream connectivity partner. The impact is currently expected to be limited to 2G and 3G devices or 4G LTE devices that performed combined attachments. 4G LTE devices configured to only connect to the 4G LTE network are not expected to be impacted. Similar to earlier, stationary devices already connected to the network are not expected to have lost connectivity. Super SIMs in devices that are failing to connect or reconnect are expected to fallback to backup IMSIs on the SIMs allowing devices to reconnect using the other IMSIs if coverage is available on network supported by the other IMSIs.

The number of active data sessions has recovered to pre-incident levels. While we are observing devices creating new attachments and connecting, we continue to observe some elevated signaling levels that indicate that our downstream connectivity partner has not fully recovered and there may continue to be impact. We will keep this incident in investigating while we work with them to return to normal levels. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to experience Super SIM connectivity issues causing attachment failures. Beginning at 09:45 UTC, we began to observe elevated signalling traffic from one of our downstream connectivity partners, during which new attachments to cellular networks or handoffs to other towers for non-stationary devices may have experienced issues. Devices that were already connected to a cellular network and had an active data session may not have experienced any impact. At 10:07 UTC, all signalling traffic from the impacted partner was lost. At this point, all new attachments and location updates for devices using IMSIs from the impacted parter were expected to fail. Super SIMs should have begun to fallback to other IMSIs on the SIM if devices were previously using the impacted partner IMSIs and were now failing to connect. We observed an increase in the number of new connections on IMSIs from other partners during this time. At 11:39 UTC, signalling traffic from the impacted partner resumed and new attachments were successful again. However, our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to experience signalling outage with one of the providers. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing signalling outage with one of the providers. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing signalling outage with one of the providers. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: No Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We determined that that a small number of JS client connection attempts using the IE1 and AU1 home regions were affected between 11:23 PM PDT and 11:28 PM PDT. The issue is resolved, and there is no further impact to customers.

Upon further investigation, we have confirmed that the Voice client is not affected by the ongoing incident. We are actively investigating the issue causing service interruption with JS client calls in the AU1 and IE1 home regions due to authentication errors and will provide another update as soon as possible.

We are continuing our investigation and have discovered that the JS client calls in the AU1 and IE1 regions are affected by this issue. We expect to provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating a service interruption with JS client calls in the au1 and ie1 home regions due to authentication errors. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Programmable Messaging affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Messaging was degraded for 14 minutes between 02:28 and 2:42 Pacific Time on 06/12/2024. During this period, customers may have experienced SMS delivery failures to AT&T when sending from Twilio short codes. The issue has now been resolved.
